website_summaries.verdict: The Netgear N600 Wireless Dual Band Router WNDR3400 is a great dual-band router for any home at an affordable price. Its lack of Gigabit Ethernet might steer enthusiasts away, however.
pros: The Netgear N600 Wireless Dual Band Router WNDR3400 supports true dual-band and offers fast wireless performance and long range
It has a useful set of networking features, such as Guest zone, network storage, traffic meter, and USB external hard-drive support for network storage
Also, it's aesthetically pleasing and affordable and comes with an intuitive Web interface
cons: The Netgear N600 Wireless Dual Band Router WNDR3400 doesn't offer Gigabit Ethernet and its network storage performance could be better

customer_reviews.title: Product claims to support up to 600 MBPS speed but doesn't! Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This product does not perform as advertised. Feels a bit like a bait and switch. It clearly states in the manual and marketing literature that it supports up to 600MBPS speed while the actual hardware ports only allow 100MBPS. Feels a lot like false advertising when you are buying the device to allow for upgrading your internet lines in the future. This router will only support 100MBPS internet speeds. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Terri Foote

customer_reviews.title: ADEQUATE FOR DESULTORY USER
customer_reviews.text: For a daily, albeit unprofessional user, I found this router OK. Setup was NOT intuitive, but accomplished. Attempts to change the factory setup keys to something I wished provided fruitless, so I just went with those provided. Firmware updating the router since production initially seemed to be problematic, but has since settled down and the router hasn't lost signal again. Signal strength and speed appears to now be solely a function of the ISP. Understanding this is an older router model is incumbent on the purchaser, and its performance should be adjudged accordingly. Generally you get what you pay for, and realize you can't put a saddle on a sow !
customer_reviews.author: RETIRED USCG CWO

customer_reviews.title: Is doesn’t not provide a good WiFi connection, just causes it to buffer.
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for a N300 that stopped working. This router didn’t work, it would continually buffer and never had a good connection. Chatted with Netgear tech to figure out the issue. Chatted with tech support for almost an hour and all did was ask the same question all over again and had me reset the router multiple times. Resetting consisted of just unplugging it and plugging it back in with the same results, continuous buffer. Not a good router or customer tech service. I own two other Netgear routers and they work with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Linebacker#82

customer_reviews.title: Broke in less than 4 years.
customer_reviews.text: This router is well below average in my opinion. The medialink base model worked for my parents for a decade, with no signal loss, and had better range. This thing drops signal, which is the worst, it never produces the highest speed I get 100mbs but maxes around 60 when I test it. Then drops to 10, or 5, and back to 25. I had it in a cool basement, never gets above 62 degrees F. In a well ventilated area, and it still managed to degrade over time. Do not buy.
customer_reviews.author: john

customer_reviews.title: Nice product, but tech support?
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I needed wifi to WFH. My building has Spectrum which charges $5 monthly to rent its router which is why I bought this. It took the Spectrum tech over 3 hours to set up my wifi. After he installed the router and created a password we learned that It d didnt meet Netgear's requirements because it didn't have an uppercase letter. We couldn't find a sipport line phone number to call. Hence it took forever for him to work around. In summary good router, bad tech support and utility tech.
customer_reviews.author: Slayr

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect
customer_reviews.text: I had a router like this that was given to me and I had it for 5 years and it worked great. I don't know how old it was when I got it but when it went out, I bought another one just like it. I am not a tech person, but I was able to set it up and connect it to my laptop, iPad, cell phones with no problem. I would highly recommend this router.
customer_reviews.author: CindyMJ

customer_reviews.title: It worked for 1 month
customer_reviews.text: I was using it for 1 month and then my neighborhood has a power outage and it stopped working. It wasn't damaged by a power surge. I have it plugged into a surge protected power strip. It was just that when it lost power, it reset itself and now it loses the password every day. I create a new password and reconnect all my devices and it works for a few hours, but then suddenly the password stops working and I have to go through the whole process again. Their customer service expires around the same time it breaks. What a waste of money! I'm going to order a different brand of router. NEVER BUY NETGEAR!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah A. Chalek

customer_reviews.title: Great router with great range
customer_reviews.text: If you’re second guessing your routers speed, you need this affordable router. My internet plan is for 100mbs but my old router was only able to put out 30mbs. Finally with this new router I get my full 100mbs, I have a decent sized house and I receive WiFi throughout my entire house. The 5G feature is amazing as it produces faster WiFi speeds.
customer_reviews.author: Christian

customer_reviews.title: Easy set-up, good value
customer_reviews.text: Easy set-up, took minutes. Connection solid, no drops in 4 days. Have 2 I pads, 2 Roku TVs, 2 laptops, a desktop, cell phone and printer. Set-up devices capable of 5g on the 5G network and the others on the 2.4g, internet speed is what you'd expect from the ISP plan (get about half the ISP speed, downstairs from router on PC; IPad on 5g gets about 70%). Genie is good for monitoring network and/or making changes if required. Not an expert on networks but based on actual in home use, seems value for money.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin FL

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Filthy
customer_reviews.text: I have not yet turned this on, but I assume it works. However it arrived absolutely filthy. I did clean it before handling it, but it is so dirty that it is still dirty under the plastic covering. Not sure I am going to keep, I may toss it because it is so unpleasant and write this up to a not so good purchasing experience. I am a rancher and work in dirt all day, so I am not fussy, but this was filth not dirt and was really bad. Would have added a photo, but I cleaned it before I thought about it. Simply a yucky purchase. To the seller, please take a little more care before shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: QOS features are the reason I bought this.
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately only upstream bandwidth limitations are able to be made on a per-device level, so my home network with only 8megs down and .5megs gets wrecked pretty hard no matter what, but the QOS does exactly what I wanted for the most part. Downloads on my laptop (like steam updating a random game) would normally spike my ping in CS:GO to 500-1000 spikes it by 20ms on average. This is one less excuse for my garbage game-play now gone... Downsides: - wifi signal is a little weak, weaker than my original ISP provided modem. - ugly as sin - tries to get you to sign up for "netgear" social media garbage
customer_reviews.author: Wesley

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and Easy
customer_reviews.text: Obviously not the top of the line but if you just need a router for a few people to use, it is very reliable and has no problems at all. It is not a high class game router...it is just to get a few people online via wireless. It performs that mission credibly.
customer_reviews.author: George Knighton

customer_reviews.title: NETGEAR N600 Router
customer_reviews.text: I like the size of the device and functions it has along with the capabilities it can provide. Pricing very reasonable and easy to install with directions. I don't have WiFi but was able to "hardwire" to get my needs done. RECOMMENDED PRODUCT and has several + seller reviews and product reviews. Cheaper than going through Internet provider and having to pay monthly fees and installation fees.
customer_reviews.author: bluegrasspioneer fan

customer_reviews.title: and I'm pretty sure one the ports are bad
customer_reviews.text: I actual have used netgear for a long time but I bought a new one in July 2017 and now I do not believe it is working. Though there is no help through theses guys. I had to Google to find a number when I did it offers no support whatsoever, in fact if you want any help after 90 days you have to pay them??? Though they offer lifetime warranty on hardware, and I'm pretty sure one the ports are bad, woohoo I'll have to buy another, it won't be this type of company
customer_reviews.author: RHarper

customer_reviews.title: great basic modem
customer_reviews.text: all the wifi modems these days are way too fancy and expensive. this modem does the job. you can turn off the 5G via the router's homepage. you can also allow/block certain users from accessing. one thing, i wish it measured data in gigabytes instead of bytes, would make for a more simple glance at how close we are to our data cap. (which is another setting you can disable access once a cap has been reached)
customer_reviews.author: Jenna Calcyone

customer_reviews.title: Netgear ALWAYS a winner
customer_reviews.text: My old Netgear was kinda good. This new Netgear hasn’t failed me even with all the AI I have going ! Easy instructions. Setup is a breeze! Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: It Just Works
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an older model that just died. I have two or three routers in my house. I need multiple because the house is built with reinforced concrete and the signal won't get through multi walls. I plugged it in, added the router to tablets, phones, radio, etc. and it works. No set up, no fuss. It has the blue dome but it does not light. The old one had a switch to turn the light on/off. Not an issue. Works for me. I will probably get another one like it to replace one I had in a window to cover the yard from the other end of the house. Hope this lasts another ten years.
customer_reviews.author: pctools

customer_reviews.title: Pooped out after 6 months.
customer_reviews.text: I was happy with this for the first 5-6 months but then my internet starting to get painfully slow and even turned on and off. Sometimes I could get it to come back on by umplugging the router and plugginh it back in but not always and it always happened at the worst times. I plugged the ethernet cable directly into my comouter so I know it's not my modem. Was hoping for a better product from Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: Monkeyfish

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: It has worked great. I didnt rate the tech support because I have not had to contact them so I have no data to base a review on. I would recommend to anyone who has never used a wifi router like these to make sure to follow the directions in the order they are told to insure it works properly. Otherwise it sometimes does not work correctly and will have to be fully unhooked and setup again
customer_reviews.author: Snowtiger19

customer_reviews.title: Good at first but fizzled out after a short time
customer_reviews.text: This router started out great but I cannot seem to get any decent speeds with it now. I have tried everything I can think of and used their support website and it is no longer yielding the speeds it advertises. The best speeds I can obtain via WiFi now are around 25 Mbps and when I use my computer via a lan cable directly to my router I get around 230 Mbps. Not sure why this router isn't providing the same speeds like it used to when I first bought it but I am very sad that it doesn't anymore since I really liked it at first.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Flynn

customer_reviews.title: False advertisement
customer_reviews.text: So my cable ISP suggested the N600 for my new service with 200 mbs Internet. Received it today. Speed direct from modem was 240 mbs. From N600 direct cable or WiFi was around 92 mbs. After 45 minutes wait, NetGear tech support said it was only 100 mbs. All over their box says 300 + 300 mbs. I am paying for 200 mbs speed, I need a router that will truly send 200 mbs over wifi. Says it does but doesn't. Waste of time. IF you only need less than 100, then it is good.
customer_reviews.author: Richard C McEwan

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase at a low cost
customer_reviews.text: Received quickly.My (very) old NetGear router finally died. I use DSL & needed a replacement WiFi router for my laptop & other devices. Product was super easy to set up & have running in no time. Great purchase at a low cost. Note: I have not needed tech support and haven't used for gaming so cannot comment on those points.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Not sure if it’s worth it, or if there’s better options
customer_reviews.text: It’s hot and miss. Sometimes a get a great signal, other times I get an ok signal, but regardless of the signal, the internet connection is never that great.
customer_reviews.author: josh

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: The Good The Netgear N600 Wireless Dual Band Router WNDR3400 supports true dual-band and offers fast wireless performance and long range. It has a useful set of networking features, such as Guest zone, network storage, traffic meter, and USB external hard-drive support for network storage. Also, it's aesthetically pleasing and affordable and comes with an intuitive Web interface. The Bad The Netgear N600 Wireless Dual Band Router WNDR3400 doesn't offer Gigabit Ethernet and its network storage performance could be better. The Bottom Line The Netgear N600 Wireless Dual Band Router WNDR3400 is a great dual-band router for any home at an affordable price. Its lack of Gigabit Ethernet might steer enthusiasts away, however.
customer_reviews.author: vincent

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great features for an inexpensive router. It has been about 7 years since I had to buy a new router. The features available now at this price point are awesome. I particularly like the administration software, the multiple ports and multiple networks. Another thing I really like is the ability to plug in a USB device for network storage. It's great for backups and file sharing alternative to the Cloud.
customer_reviews.author: Darin Brown

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT UPGRADE FIRMWARE !!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have had several NETGEAR routers. I like how they work. I like the software, I ABSOLUTELY ABHOR THE FIRMWARE UPGRADE AND THEN DEALING WITH NETGEAR SUPPORT !!! Each time I performed the recommended firmware upgrade I lost ALL of the SECURITY FEATURES associated with the WIRELESS utility of the router. NO SECURITY. NO PASSWORD ACCEPTED, NO RESET. and NO SUPPORT solutions. I will NOT BUY ANOTHER NETGEAR product.
customer_reviews.author: J. Smith

customer_reviews.title: setup not intuitive
customer_reviews.text: Setup is garbage, any other router is plug in and it works. I had to login into the web browser and create a new gear login before I could access the internet. I was very frustrated. Sonif it not connecting, its because you have to create a login before it connects to the internet. Super illogical.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Duenes

customer_reviews.title: No longer buy these
customer_reviews.text: For years I bought these routers along with the N900, but no more. I have installed 19 routers for my customers in 2013, and at the time of this review, all but 2 or 3 of them are still working. The wireless radios go in them, or they just go all together and you get 2 yellow lights on the front. These routers are good because they have nice radio range, but it does not matter if they cannot last a full year. Don't waste your money, I now use CISCO for routers and ASUS for access points, have not had a single one fail yet.
customer_reviews.author: Ray D - Pittsburgh

customer_reviews.title: Awkward parental controls
customer_reviews.text: The parental controls could use more flexibility. You can filter by time but not by day, so school nights must have the same settings as weekends. You also can't simply block a device such as a specific phone. You must globally filter classes of websites, then set up exceptions for the parental units. The website-based controls also require an account with a password separate from the router itself, which is rather involved. Sometimes it's simpler to just press the WIFI kill button on the router housing, which is nice but isn't a program. (Edited to reflect helpful comment from support below, thanks.)
customer_reviews.author: Bill Haywood

customer_reviews.title: Won't connect to internet via Modem
customer_reviews.text: I took a chance on a reconditioned router -- bad idea. Everything works -- except an actual connect to the internet. I'm a degreed Computer Science professional. It appears that the ethernet chip itself is at fault. I was able to reconfigure every parameter possible -- to no avail. Perhaps whoever tested it was happy to see it power-up with it's menus -- but never actually hooked it up to a live modem. I won't take a chance like that again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s been working great.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this since August. I didn’t want to pay spectrum even more money to “rent” a router from them. But I have had no issues with my WiFi at all. I have a smart tv, 2 laptops, 2 smartphones, a kindle, an Alexa and 2 smart plugs all running through the same network. No issues streaming or anything. I don’t know a lot about routers but this one seems to be great, especially for the price
customer_reviews.author: Kma24

customer_reviews.title: Easy
customer_reviews.text: I have had this router model in duty for many years. I purchased this latest one to configure as a utility infielder and have ti ready to plug in in case the active DR3400 face plants. Setup/config screens were easier with this v3 than the original 3400 screens.
customer_reviews.author: Archer

customer_reviews.title: No Tech Support after 6 months
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know if it’s the Router or my internet service but we have to unplug/plugin the router almost every day, usually several times a day, because we keep losing wi-fi service. Internet provider says it's not them, must be router. Since the router is more than 6 months old Netgear wants to charge me by the call or an annual fee in order to talk to their Tech Support. I wouldn’t buy another Netgear product!
customer_reviews.author: SleepShopper

customer_reviews.title: It works but downgrade from wndr3300
customer_reviews.text: this is a step down from previous wndr3300, I'll stick with it, but cheapened quality, no light under blue dome like older models, reduced size. Update: 8 months in and Router is losing signal and having to unplug and relug to get a signal, having to do this about every 3 hours. I had old version of this that lasted YEARS with no issues, but new version is not dependable, not sure I can trust this brand anymore, reminds me of faulty Belkn routers.
customer_reviews.author: FrugalFreak

customer_reviews.title: easy to install, but...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good, dependable router. It is easy to install, with a easily attainable connection (in other words, your connection will not drop out because of the router.). BUT, if you are expecting it to cover any distance in your house with a strong connection, forget it. My house is only 1550 sq. ft., and not all rooms get a good connection. Some rooms only get 2 bars at best. This is not what I had hoped. So I am extremely disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tink Boncler

customer_reviews.title: Great for better Wi-Fi access! Easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Great for better Wi-Fi signal. We don't "game" so I really can't rate it for that. Easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does the job well.
customer_reviews.text: This is a solid router for a small-medium sized home. Features (2.4 and 5.0GHz band, guest networks, NAT settings, security) were in line with the amount you pay for it. 4-port switch is just about what anyone needs (AppleTV + gaming system, etc) next to the device. Minimal footprint and pretty reliable. It does play nicely with a multitude of devices as I have 5 Apple products, 2 Windows devices, an Xbox, Playstation, etc. Supports a number of devices on the network before things go a little shaky (did a LAN with 12+ computers and consoles). If you can get it for <$50, definitely a solid buy.
customer_reviews.author: thomas hinson

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working in 3 months.  Can’t return.
customer_reviews.text: I received this product in January. Worked fine. Then all of a sudden it stopped working today. 3 months only! Now every time it gets to the “Applying internet connection settings” it disconnects from the router. And apparently I can’t return it now- only had one month to do so. I think a product should be returnable in 3 months if it does not work. Be cautious when purchasing.
customer_reviews.author: Lori G.

customer_reviews.title: Slower than my trusty old WRT54G
customer_reviews.text: Bought this Netgear WNDR3400v1 Jan 30, 2013 for $29.48. Will be returning it for refund, since its performance is poor. Pros: On plugging it in, it automatically asked me to install the latest firmware from Netgear, which I did. Cheap price. Cons: You get what you pay for. This is the WNDR3400 v1, not the latest version 3. Despite configuring it for 300 Mbps, it connects at 144 Mbps or lower. Wireless throughput is 16-18 Mbps, compared to my old Linksys WRT54G which achieved 20-22 Mbps. I gave it a week and no amount of tweaking helped. It's slower than my trusty old Linksys WRT54G v8. I will be returning this for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Dale G

customer_reviews.title: 8 year old 150 is 4x faster
customer_reviews.text: Connected it, configured it, updated firmware, ran speed test and average is under 6Mbps. Connected the old one to verify service provider line was good, averaged over 140Mbps. Contacted Amazon, but because it was a gift and not opened until after the return window, they said too bad, call Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: A Homan

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install!!
customer_reviews.text: We needed a new one after...well...having one that was from 2010. Easy to install and easy instructions. A little annoying to change the password of every household tech item, but necessary. Worked the second it was installed. Sleek look and you can barely see it. Looks like a book from afar. Good product and I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: ShinFuranSan

customer_reviews.title: Easily Copes with Four (Wired) Netflix fans and thew Wifi Isn't Bad Either.
customer_reviews.text: All good. Just remember the right sequence: cable from rest of World goes to modem, Ethernet cable goes from modem to router. Second cable goes from router to switch. If you put the router anywhere other than between the modem and the first switch it's likely to mess up all your IP addresses. Speed-wise it happily copes with four Netflix watchers at the same time. Wifi-wise we're just using this a s a router, and the unit is housed inside a steel panel, so no opinions.
customer_reviews.author: Darren H

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the hassle
customer_reviews.text: Could not connect to internet. Did not like the fact that you have to fully register the router (creating a login password and security questions ) before you can use it. After all of that and a call to help line in South Korea I still could not get on to the internet via Wi-Fi. Returned and bought a different brand which connected with no registration and no issues. I gave it one star should actually get zero stars.
customer_reviews.author: KC

customer_reviews.title: Honest Seller on Amazon
customer_reviews.text: Dynamustech Solutions has courteously approved complete refund of the item that was not suitable for my application. I was under the mistaken belief that the router could work as a Bridge Network that I needed to us as a secure wi-fi repeater. Router only works when wired directly to modem with RJ45 cable.
customer_reviews.author: jimbmw

customer_reviews.title: Netgear N600 for trouble spot.
customer_reviews.text: we purchased a few Netgear in the past & always had good experience. Netgear N600 work great out of the box. small, compact to fit into cable box hub or small area. Great for apartment away from cable wifi outlet. . Wifi signal is enought for trouble spot.
customer_reviews.author: Herbert Gonzalez

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable router
customer_reviews.text: I have a smallish apartment so I didn't need a router with a whole lot of range, but this covers the apartment very well, and is incredibly simple to set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: Aubrey Koebach

customer_reviews.title: Only 1 channel works.
customer_reviews.text: Junk! Reading other reviews, I think people are peddling used known defects on Amazon. Took me 2 months to realize the 5G band only works intermittently. Not happy.
customer_reviews.author: moi

customer_reviews.title: No longer supported... 3 years old, now trash.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for 3 years. Original set up was fine, but I recently learned the parental controls were no longer working. So I updated the firmware and downloaded the latest version of Genie, only to find this model is no longer supported by Genie. Genie will load.. but it will not complete the open DNS connection. You cannot access the parental controls without Genie.. so now there is no way to control the parental control settings. Go read the hundreds of forum postings about folks with the same issue. Unbelievable....
customer_reviews.author: Elan

customer_reviews.title: Poor Connectivity / No Refunds allowed
customer_reviews.text: I previously had a Netgear router that lasted nearly 7 years. When I replaced it with this one, my connection was continually dropping and I would repeatedly have to shut down my computer and/or cell phone to try and re-connect. Thought it was my ISP provider but it was, in fact, the router. Will be sending it back, unfortunately. NO REFUNDS ALLOWED--PURCHASE WITH CAUTION. "Exchanges" only? Terrible service.
customer_reviews.author: dakotakid

customer_reviews.title: won't buy another
customer_reviews.text: i spent 3 hours on the phone with tech support, and i could not sign into the internet.Tried everything , i had an earlier model that worked fine for 3 years then quit.Never even was able to get the new one working. Because of the lack of understanding between tech support and i. I will never purchase another net gear product. Now maybe i got a lemon i don't know. But after 3 hours with tech support something should of been resolved , they basically told me to unplug it and restart everything and call them back . I chose to send the unit back instead.
customer_reviews.author: mike

customer_reviews.title: Good product for good price
customer_reviews.text: Bought this item along with Netgear cable modem for Wifi replacing my old comcast modem and wifi router. Wifi speed and range is good and also wifi connection is very good in my bedroom when compared to my old comcast modem and router which I had to reset many times and also in bedroom wifi connection used to suck. Only if I close my bedroom door wifi connection shrinks a little and video buffering might slow down a bit, which I think is ok considering the distance and also the location where my wifi is placed in my living room.
customer_reviews.author: Santhosh

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Everything was working fine, I was getting 100mbps just like I was paying my provider for, then at at 96 days all my streaming started bogging down, and i did a speed test and I was slowed down to 45 mbps, I calls my provider and we hardwired to my laptop and i still was at 100mbps, so they said it was this router, I called netgear and they said I was outside the 90 day warranty by 6 days and it would be $149 for them to trouble shoot, I only paid $60 for the freaking router. Very upset with the service. Gee how convenient it craps out 1 week out of warranty, that was a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not enough bandwidth!
customer_reviews.text: Extremely disappointed with this router. Fire stick in the next room from router and the one upstairs will not work! Last night I got an onscreen message from the fire stick that there was not enough bandwidth to stream an Amazon prime show upstairs! What's the point of a wireless router if you have to be in the same darn room to use it??!!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: OK
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work as well as expected. If you're next to the router you'll get a great signal. Up 1/2 floor in the kitchen and signal in only medium. Out side to the patio and zippo. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Snoopy

customer_reviews.title: Great Refurb Router!
customer_reviews.text: For the price, its the best bang for buck for a wireless N600 router. It is refurbished, but I received it in like new condition and it performs flawlessly. I am upgrading from a Linksys N150 router so this is quite a performance jump. Some of the pros include dual band 2.4/5 GHz operation, good signal strength and speed, and my favorite is the guest network. The guest network makes my life very convenient and secure as my friends can connect to my WiFi and access internet only while keeping off my personal network, very intuitive feature that I am loving. I wish it had gigabit Ethernet, but I cannot complain at this price point.
customer_reviews.author: Cesar Sanchez

customer_reviews.title: Bad wire
customer_reviews.text: Netgear isn’t not as it once was, bad, had to replace, it went out 5 days after warranty, netgear refused to do anything and were very rude, Amazon replaced it for free due to the bad time netgear gave me, Kudos to Amazon!!
customer_reviews.author: Methundercat

customer_reviews.title: I was having trouble with my older router which was ...
customer_reviews.text: I was having trouble with my older router which was not up to the job, but this was more than I could ask for. I have a security camera that used wi-fi and it was disconnecting all the time. Since I got this router Iv'e never had a problem with connecting and that makes me very happy
customer_reviews.author: big foot

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting and worth the price.
customer_reviews.text: Now I'm using this router as an AP. That being said I've had the thing for nearly 4 years and even when I upgraded (we got a larger place) the router was still working strong. I would definitely recommend the thing to any of my friends.
customer_reviews.author: xXGhosterXx

customer_reviews.title: On time delivery of defective router
customer_reviews.text: Defective product!! Router does not work. I thought maybe it was an "operator error" so I asked my computer nerd brother to come over and help me set it up. He also was unsuccessful so he took it home to try it there just to make sure it wasn't an issue with my internet connection or Ethernet cable. Still no luck. I contacted joycells who told me to go through netgear who told me to call joycells. After getting the runaround the 30 day warranty is now past. Very frustrating! Waste of money and time. I will not purchase from joycells again! One star because I can't give zero and it was delivered on time.
customer_reviews.author: SARAC

customer_reviews.title: Horrible range compared to our Xfinity modem/router
customer_reviews.text: So disappointed that it actually decreased our range, significantly. We can't even get a signal in the next friggin room now, for crying out loud. We don't want to pay $10/month to rent an Xfinity router so will be purchasing a Netgear range extender and hope that helps. If not, everything's getting returned. No issues with speed in the one room we can pick up wifi in, so I added back one star for that. But man, the wifi range suuuuucks.
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality
customer_reviews.text: Terrible product and terrible support. Wifi connection constantly dropping. Wasted many hours resetting and troubleshooting to finally realize that it's simply a poorly designed router that can't hold a solid WIFI connection. Save your money and find a better alternative from a different company.
customer_reviews.author: AMZreviews

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Worked out of the box, purchased used. Set up was straight forward. I like the no external antennae since I use it portable for digital sound mixers and carry it in a bag with the mixer.
customer_reviews.author: Techie Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great router, not the easiest set up
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this router for my sister (who is absolutely not tech savvy) for Christmas. My husband and I set up the network for her before wrapping the gift. This was more difficult than I think it should have been. I attempted to set it up from my Windows 8 machine wirelessly (which appeared to work and then errored out). We finally ended up setting the router up with an XP machine via network cable. However, when I took the router to her house and plugged it in (it replaced one that was no longer functioning) all the house electronics found the network with no problem and it has been operating without incident since.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work, cheap yellow cord.
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work, yellow cord is extremely fragile. They want me to pay for postage to send back, that is half the cost of what I paid. Don't waste your time or money here.
customer_reviews.author: Lindsey A.

customer_reviews.title: netgear n600
customer_reviews.text: it quit working after 10 months.it says it has a lifetime warranty. good luck with that.i can't even get netgear to talk to me without giving a credit card to pay them. I am giving netgear 5 stars now because they did contact me with an email an called me, the guy told me what to do and he said that the enternet conection on the router went out. They sent me a new router and it works fine. So NETGEAR is alright.I thank them.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase! No issue being refurb
customer_reviews.text: Overall excellent purchase. Bought this with a new, upgraded cable modem and went from 5-10 Mbps to 20-25 Mbps. (will depend on your service provider also of course). Did have one minor issue at first. Every 24 HRS or so the signal would drop in and out until I powered it down and back up. Researched a bit and after much trial and error found that the channels were being interfered with by neighbors who were using similar channels. Moved both transmitter channels away from those being used by neighbors and have not had an issue since! No issues with it being refurb either. 3rd different refurb device I have bought from Amazon with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Boiler98

customer_reviews.title: This has to be the worst product I ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: It works for like a week. Then it doesn't matter what you do, it won't connect to the internet. Support says to either update firmware or reset it to factory settings. After doing that it still won't work. Leave it unplugged for a week and then it works... for a couple of weeks and then repeat the process. It says it does a max of 300 mbps but my 200 mbps internet can only go 30 mbps on it.
customer_reviews.author: shawn

customer_reviews.title: Not very good
customer_reviews.text: I don't use this one it never worked well. Didn't get around to returning it!
customer_reviews.author: Bea Hanson

customer_reviews.title: Easiest set up ever
customer_reviews.text: I used to be a stalwart Linksys fan but I have now converted to Netgear and I have to say they are much more user friendly. I have a Netgear modem and this new router was connected to the internet within a couple minutes of plugging it in. A couple of easy changes to the wifi settings for my own custom SSID and password using Netgear's very user friendly interface, and I was up and running quickly. Nice strong signal, and a noticeable wifi speed difference over my old Netgear Rangemax G wireless router, which was still working great after 6 years.
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: Love it, a great improvement!
customer_reviews.text: Works unbleivably well, and it does not conflict with the Cisco commercial (SPA504G) internet phones that we use with Vonage Business.
customer_reviews.author: AZ Senior

customer_reviews.title: Worked great but
customer_reviews.text: Once it started failing it went down hill fast, all devices would disconnect then fail to connect. had to keep rebooting the router. After opening a case with CS department and month later they finally offered me an RMA but I had to ship my router in and wait a week for the return. I'm starting to experience the same issues with the new replacement, purchase with care, I'm going back to D-Link UPDATE: I wish there was a way to give it ZERO stars, this works great in the begging then goes down hill fast and CS does a poor job. This is my first and last NetGear anything. Will go back to D-Link or LinkSys/Cisco.
customer_reviews.author: Walter

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. Bought this netgear router August 2019. Been good since, haven't run into any issues that we know were due to the router. (This router reviewed on 1/30/2020)
customer_reviews.author: TMW2005

customer_reviews.title: Bought for my Xfinity Service
customer_reviews.text: Why pay a monthly fee for the $9 Xfinity Router when you can buy your own. Easy to setup, it's faster than the cheap Xfinity Router, and reliability has been good.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: So far it's very good. The signal reaches almost all of our 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: So far it's very good. The signal reaches almost all of our 2 story 3000+ home with strong signal. It's easy setup, as well. Follow basic instructions on tri-fold included. Use online www.routerlogin.net. Then download and use the Netgear genie to adjust the WiFi name and password for your network. One side note. If you decide to use the same WiFi name for this new router as your old router, you need to reset your iphone/ipad network for it to work on those devices (Settings>General>Reset>Reset Network Settings)
customer_reviews.author: L. K. Harris

customer_reviews.title: NetGear gives me all I need.
customer_reviews.text: Whether it's for browsing, watching videos, playing games or watching streaming TV with NO signal loss at all and no waiting for the buffering symbol, because there is NONE.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Pankowski

customer_reviews.title: I won't buy another
customer_reviews.text: I was wanting to like this router, good name, good price, everything I needed. I couldn't get it to connect with my RCA modem. No tech support, no manual, no installation software included. If you want a manual, you have to download one. If you want tech support, you will have to pay more than the router cost. I spent hours on the phone with my internet company, they couldn't get it working either. After hours of frustration, I gave up. I am sending it back to Amazon for a refund, and I am going try a NEW Linksys E1200. I hope that one will work. No more refurbished for me.
customer_reviews.author: Classic1500

customer_reviews.title: Good Router at a Good Price
customer_reviews.text: You never know what you will get with reconditioned merchandise. I was concerned about this purchase when I saw the scratches on the router's casing. It is obvious that this is not just a factory second or a repackaged unit, but has had significant use. Makes me wonder what problem its first user had that warranted returning it (were the damages caused when it was thrown out of a window in frustration?). Cosmetic issues aside, so far it works well. It was easy to set up, basically plug & play. Stays connected even with our sketchy cable internet service. Range is just ok.
customer_reviews.author: ta999

customer_reviews.title: The fastest death of a router I have ever had.
customer_reviews.text: I wavered when I bought this, but thought, it's so cheap, even if it breaks in six months, it will have been worth it. Except it didn't last a lot longer than a month. I was annoyed, but not surprised. So, I'm in the buyer beware camp. And I don't like how one star is - I hate it. One star should be - I hate that I wasted my money on it and it stopped working (just) after the time ended when I could send it back. Or maybe there should be a minus one star for products that do that, like this one.
customer_reviews.author: noOne

customer_reviews.title: Decent router not very powerful
customer_reviews.text: This router works well for surfing, but I recommend spending the money on a better router if you want to stream video or play games.
customer_reviews.author: gobot02

customer_reviews.title: Great range and speeds.
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased this along with a new ARRIS modem to replace my leased one from Time Warner Cable. Setup was quick and easy and I had all my devices connected in short order. I am very pleased with the speeds and range. I get a great signal throughout my house and even in my detached garage and even in my shed which is over 100 ft. away from the router and 3 walls. I love the 2.4 and 5 dual band option which gives me the option to use it on all my electronics old and new.
customer_reviews.author: A. White

customer_reviews.title: Good Router
customer_reviews.text: I really like this router, but one downside – once I enabled Remote Management, it semi-permanently ruined my ability to use Port 80 for my home server. Had to do a factory reset to get Port 80 functionality back (even after disabling RM). So that cost a star...
customer_reviews.author: DJDave

customer_reviews.title: Really like Netgear products
customer_reviews.text: Have the N9000 and wanted another for another computer with security cameras so sure this will be just what I needed for the job
customer_reviews.author: frank f

customer_reviews.title: Average performance for us
customer_reviews.text: We didn't see very good performance with this unit and ended up returning it. We replaced our XFinity modem/router with this unit plus an Arris modem and our wireless performance went way down.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Smith

customer_reviews.title: Works perfect, easy plug and play
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, no start up install needed. Works fast and dependably with great range. Used it in a 1950s 1500 sq ft ranch house and had great wifi inside and out wherever I went, now I'm in a two story larger townhouse and it was just as easy to switch everything over and set up again. Power outages had no effect, though I now have it all plugged into a back up UPS/surge protector. I highly recommend taking digital pictures of the easy set up sheet and the login/pw/bar code from the box for safe keeping long term. Used for xfinity comcast internet with a NETGEAR DOCSIS 3.0 340 Mbps Cable Modem.
customer_reviews.author: J. BushTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Nice basic router
customer_reviews.text: These are our go to routers when we just need a basic router and they seem to hold up and work well.
customer_reviews.author: JeffC

customer_reviews.title: Awesome router!!!
customer_reviews.text: I got it within 2 days of ordering and it took 5 minutes to setup! Nothing to download and nothing to install!! I disabled the default wireless router given by Time Warner and another Linksys router that I had which both failed to reach from basement to 2nd floor. Netgear has 75% signals even in the farthest corner of the house two floors up!! And the wireless in my TV works without buffering as well. I reused SSID from disabled wireless and I didn't have to change any settings for any devices! In short fantastic product, great price .. couldn't have asked for more!!
customer_reviews.author: Martin King

customer_reviews.title: This thing friggin ROCKS!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing friggin ROCKS!! Killer speeds, great admin UI, the USB port and connection to an external HDD works like a charm, and it's hella cheap! Heads up: the blue lights on the side cannot be turned off, and they are pretty bright... Buying remanufactured electronics is the way to go. They are the only products to actually have professional technician hands on them, and they are put through burn in tests. You don't get any of that from an assembly line of new products.
customer_reviews.author: Israelius

customer_reviews.title: Netgear Genie
customer_reviews.text: I dont know if any one has had this problem but my router did not setup with a password. If this happens to you then i recommend getting the netgear genie (google it) install it, follow their instructions to sign on (and maybe the FAQ on netgears site for extra help). Once you are signed on you can make/change the password. I had trouble becoming the "administrator" (required to access password controls) on netgear genie until i connected my the router to my computer via ethernet cord. Hope this helps anyone that has this issue. OTHERWISE, Great product i would recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: not a good way to save money.
customer_reviews.text: This router is not only not covered by warranty but it also doesn't qualify for their tech support help. The first one I got was DOA and the second one worked okay but topped out at about 33mbps and caused quite a bit of issue with my airport express. I upgraded to an Asus RTN66U and was immediately getting about double the speed out of my internet connection. If this didn't show up with Netgear as being years old and actually qualified for the tech support then it would be a good option for anyone with slower internet. Since you are on your own with it though I wouldn't recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: A. Kay

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this junk!!
customer_reviews.text: I would give this ZERO stars if I could!! This replaced an older Netgear router that was giving us problems. Needless to say, the old one worked like a champ compared to this one! We lost 98÷ off connectivity. I thought it was the 5G but we switched to the normal one and that didn't work either. The laptop either doesn't work or takes 1/2 to load. Our phones work 1.5 ÷. Don't waste your money.....returning this garbage and already bought a different brand. Wow. Typing this on my 4G ticks me off....because I can't access my wifi!!
customer_reviews.author: yoopgirl

customer_reviews.title: Refurbished means better price
customer_reviews.text: I am poor so I love when I can buy refurbished electronics. Not once have I made a purchase and had a device of lesser quality than everyone else, I was just smarter than them and therefore I save a ton of money. Easy to install, four teenagers tend to freak when the internet goes down so be prepared for the yelling.."MOM whats wrong with the internet..I was watching youtube" Once installed i set up the security for the router and my network and I can even monitor usage and restrict so that I can keep an eye on my kids and keep them safe.
customer_reviews.author: April M.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up and very functional -- highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is a good product. Not cheap but not expensive either. I installed it directly from Windows 7 in about three minutes. It was in operation within five minutes. It has very good range -- much better than the Linksys router it replaced. It covers three floors with no difficulty. I am the home network administrator/complaint department. There have been no complaints from my "customers" (my daughters who use the 5-G channel with their Powerbooks). It has a USB port -- so you can plug in a USB-powered drive and have network-accessible storage. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: WZ

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed in what I had known to be a quality ...
customer_reviews.text: Got the router on Aug 5, 2017. Opened the box to connect it on January 25, 2018. It will connect to the computer but will not transfer any data. A professional installer from Skyweb did the installation as I, an engineer watched.The Netgear N600 would not work at all. It certainly looked new but was dead out of the box.Another brand of router that the installer had that I borrowed worked perfectly well. Very disappointed in what I had known to be a quality unit.
customer_reviews.author: David W. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install and works very well
customer_reviews.text: Only had it for a few days but it has significantly increased my internet speed. Instructions did not come in box but I figured it out in 10 min. Will update if anything changes.
customer_reviews.author: Lex

customer_reviews.title: Works so good you forget it's there
customer_reviews.text: This unit does exactly what I wanted it to. I didn't want to think about my router anymore. My last one, another brand, had to be reset so much the family would take turns rebooting it. This router handles a Playstation, 4 iPhones, two GalAXY s3's, an Optimus G Pro and just as many laptops wireless at the same time!!! No BS I have yet to get this thing to fail in any way. I do have Comcast Xfinity with speed boost. All wired connections are cat6 ( Apple tv, wireless 3TB storage, and another Playstation). It also looks very cool with my other blue light devices.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy set up/Easy use!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up and easy to use. Our hotel did not have WI-FI, only the traditional internet connection where you plug your cord into the wall. But with several devices that we use, decided to buy this router to give us WI-FI capability. Worked like a charm! Now we can all use the internet without plugging in. Best of all, love that we can lock it with a password and you can check usage in case someone hacks in and disconnect them.
customer_reviews.author: Bernie D

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job
customer_reviews.text: This is the third N600 model router I have installed over the past four years at the three wireless sites I maintain in a stressful "do or die" work environment. Each time everything went a little smoother; from instalation to monitoring to security and my confidence in this product has grown accordingly. I am an old guy and over the years I have paid a frightening amount of money for technology products that promised the moon and delivered nothing but confusion, problems and extra work. I am delighted to find a product that delivers the goods exactly as promised and is just a little smarter than I am..
customer_reviews.author: R. D. Larson

customer_reviews.title: they have no problem getting a signal my 16year old set it up she says it was fairly easy and she did not use the directions
customer_reviews.text: The children were having issues with the WiFi from our cable company so I brought this (NetGear N600) router. We live in a 3 bedroom 2 bathroom apartment that is fairly large. they have no problem getting a signal my 16year old set it up she says it was fairly easy and she did not use the directions. They have used it on the first floor of our building we live on the 5th. They use it for multiple devices such as, Ipad, smart phones, Kindle, laptop computer.They are Very satisfied with the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Alicea Terry

customer_reviews.title: the signal is easily lost. It wasn't very expensive so I'm happy ...
customer_reviews.text: Although this works most of the time, the signal is easily lost. It wasn't very expensive so I'm happy about that. But I the tv gets scrambled easily sometimes. When I'm on the computer I bypass this router because when I'm doing a radio it definitely would be way to sketchy and unpredictable for me to use. Not recommended for those who need a reliable signal throughout the house. It does good for those on a budget (like me)
customer_reviews.author: Damon Yates

customer_reviews.title: Easy to set up & use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this, along with Netgear CM400, to avoid monthly rental fees. It works as well as the one provided by the cable company. Setup was very easy following the included instructions I would recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Evans

product_meta.title: NETGEAR N600 Dual Band Wi-Fi Router (WNDR3400)
product_meta.description:
Simultaneous dual band Wireless N offers twice the bandwidth with better connection and less interference, Ready SHARE provides fast and easy shared access to an external USB storage device, Broadband Usage Meter ensures accurate measurement of Internet traffic daily, weekly and monthly with customized alerts Live Parental Controls, powered by OpenDNS, Blocks unsafe Internet content and applications, Flexible and customizable settings through Web interface, accessible remotely, Protects devices connected through the router such as PCs, gaming consoles, and iPod touch, Multiple SSID support Set up a second network for guests with restricted access or a dedicated network for video and gaming, Automatic Quality of Service (QoS) Enjoy enhanced media, gaming, and Internet telephone performance with automatic application prioritization, Push 'N' Connect securely connects devices at the touch of a button. Spend less time installing your router and setting up your network and more time gaming, surfing the Internet, and conducting business, NETGEAR Green, Convenient one touch on/off switch and Wi Fi button conserve energy, Efficient Energy Star compliant power supply, Packaging manufactured with at least 80 percent recycled materials.WiFi Band : Simultaneous dual band 2.4GHz & 5GHz

AMAZON.COM




FROM THE MANUFACTURER


FAST MULTIMEDIA STREAMING – HIGH PERFORMANCE
The NETGEAR N600 Wireless Dual Band Router (WNDR3400) offers the high performance wireless Internet access needed for demanding applications, such as streaming multimedia and multiplayer gaming. Simultaneous Dual Band provides the best performance and minimizes interference by providing two independent, dedicated networks. The ReadySHARE USB storage allows you to convert your USB Hard drive to a network storage drive for backup.

THE NETGEAR DIFFERENCE – WNDR3400
 * Simultaneous Dual Band 300 + 300Mbps

 * ReadyShare USB Storage

 * DLNA Media Server

APPLICATIONS
Ideal for HD Video Streaming

Access and Share USB Storage

Better Online Gaming and Media Streaming

NETWORK SPEED
Faster WiFi Speed – N600 Dual Band WiFi delivers 300 + 300Mbps for combined wireless speeds up to 600MbpsWIRELESS RANGE
Range – Ideal for medium to large homesRELIABLE CONNECTIONS
Simultaneous Dual Band – Wireless access on both 2.4 & 5GHz bandsAdvanced QoS – Optimized for smooth HD streaming & gamingSHARING
ReadySHARE USB – Wirelessly access & share USB hard drivesEASE OF USE
NETGEAR genie App – Easy-to-use dashboard to monitor, control & repair home networksPush ‘N’ Connect – Secure push button WiFi connections using WiFi Protected Setup (WPS)WiFi & Power On/Off – Convenient power savings to power down the entire router and/or just WiFiSECURITY
Live Parental Controls – Centralized & easy-to-use website filtering for all devices connected to the Internet via the routerGuest Network Access – Separate & secure WiFi access for guests using your home networkSecure WiFi Connections – Highest level wireless security with WPA/WPA2 enlarge enlargeCHOOSE THE WIRELESS ROUTER THAT FITS YOUR NEEDS

 * Makes any printer AirPrint compatible to print from an iPad or iPhone

NETGEAR
PACKAGE CONTENTS

SYSTEM REQUIREMENTS
